extendedIngredients.name: vanilla wafers
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cup vanilla wafers (or vanilla almond bark), melted

recipes.title: Vanilla Bean Shortbread Cookies

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Madeira, and Prosecco are great choices for Cookies. Sweet bubbly Prosecco doesn't overwhelm simple sugar or shortbread cookies, a sweet cream sherry complements spiced cookies, and madeira's nutty notes match cookies with nuts perfectly. One wine you could try is NV Solera Cream Sherry. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: In a a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter and powdered sugar. Add vanilla bean paste and mix until fully blended. Add flour and kosher salt. If the mixture is still crumbly after blending, use hands to fully combine. Place dough on a lightly floured counter. Roll into a 12inch log. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.When ready to bake, slice dough into thin slices. Place on a parchment paper lined baking sheet and bake for 12-14 minutes in a 350 degree oven, until cookies begin to lightly brown on edges.Once cooled, spread a small amount of melted vanilla bark onto each cookie and immediate add sprinkles. Allow to set, about 15 minutes. Store in a covered container for up to 7 days. ENJOY.

steps.step: In a a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter and powdered sugar.
Add vanilla bean paste and mix until fully blended.
Add flour and kosher salt. If the mixture is still crumbly after blending, use hands to fully combine.
Place dough on a lightly floured counter.
Roll into a 12inch log. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.When ready to bake, slice dough into thin slices.

Place on a parchment paper lined baking sheet and bake for 12-14 minutes in a 350 degree oven, until cookies begin to lightly brown on edges.Once cooled, spread a small amount of melted vanilla bark onto each cookie and immediate add sprinkles. Allow to set, about 15 minutes. Store in a covered container for up to 7 days. ENJOY.
